summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorney Amanda K. Kramer and an individual from the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), discussing scheduling a call related to a pre-trial motion opposition deadline and a brief filing. The emails reference sharing notes from a February 2016 meeting and a news article about the Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Amanda K. Kramer
persons.context: She is the recipient and participant in email correspondence scheduling calls regarding a case, likely related to the Epstein/Maxwell matter, as indicated by the referenced article.

events.title: Meeting Notes Reference
events.description: Reference to notes from a meeting in February 2016, which were to be shared with Amanda Kramer. The attachment is named '2016.2.29 Meeting Notes and Business Cards.pdf'.

events.title: Brief Filing Deadline
events.description: Mention of a deadline to file a brief on Friday, February 26, 2021, necessitating a call before filing.

events.title: Witness Interviews
events.description: Amanda Kramer mentions having full days set aside for witness interviews, indicating active case preparation.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The correspondence involves Assistant U.S. Attorney Amanda K. Kramer and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) scheduling calls related to case preparation.
The emails reference a need to touch base before filing a brief on February 26, 2021, and discuss pre-trial motion opposition deadlines.
An attachment referenced is '2016.2.29 Meeting Notes and Business Cards.pdf', indicating the sharing of historical meeting notes from February 2016.
A link to a New York Daily News article about the 'Jeffrey Epstein/Maxwell case' from October 13, 2020, was shared with Amanda Kramer, suggesting the case context.
The email chain shows coordination for witness interviews and legal strategy discussions in early 2021.
